' [2026] link '36', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L36' [2028] code '' StaticText 'In the spirit of Open Source, The A11Y Project tries to only promote content that is free, or has a low barrier to entry.' ' [2124] link '50', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L50' [2126] code '' StaticText '

' [2131] link '51', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L51' [2133] code '' StaticText 'Have an idea for a post? Great! We'd love to know what you want to contribute!' [2138] link '52', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L52' [2140] code '' StaticText '

' [2145] link '53', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L53' [2147] code '' StaticText '
    ' [2152] link '54', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L54' [2154] code '' StaticText '
  1. Search our open GitHub Issues to make sure someone hasn't claimed the post already.
    2. ' [2159] link '55', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L55' [2161] code '' StaticText '
  2. Claim a post by starting a new Issue with "Post: Your title" as the Issue title. This will help us keep track of who is working on what. The final, published title can be different from the Issue name.
    3. ' [2166] link '56', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L56' [2168] code '' StaticText '
' [2173] link '57', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L57' [2175] code '' StaticText '

' [2180] link '58', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L58' [2182] code '' StaticText 'We also have a list of posts we'd love to see written!' [2187] link '59', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L59' [2189] code '' StaticText '

' [2194] link '60', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L60' [2196] code '' StaticText '

' [2201] link '61', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L61' [2203] code '' StaticText 'Writing' [2208] link '62', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L62' [2210] code '' StaticText '

' [2215] link '63', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L63' [2217] code '' StaticText '

' [2222] link '64', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L64' [2224] code '' StaticText 'Posts are written using Markdown, using a special formatting technique called front matter. Eleventy uses front matter information to create things like author attribution, categories, and page layout.' [2229] link '65', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L65' [2231] code '' StaticText '

' [2236] link '66', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L66' [2238] code '' StaticText '

' [2243] link '67', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L67' [2245] code '' StaticText 'To get started writing a post, create a feature branch and create a new Markdown file in the posts directory. The Markdown's file name should reflect the intended publishing date and the title of the post. For example, a post about accessible typography may have a filename along the lines of accessible-typography.md.' [2250] link '68', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L68' [2252] code '' StaticText '

' [2257] link '69', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L69' [2259] code '' StaticText '

' [2264] link '70', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L70' [2266] code '' StaticText 'Copying an existing post, then updating its filename and front matter to match your post can be an easy way to help ensure everything is formatted properly.' [2626] link '71', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L71' [2628] code '' StaticText '

' [2633] link '72', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/a11yproject/a11yproject.com/-/blob/main/src/contributing-guidelines.njk#L72' [2635] code '' StaticText '

  • The accessibility of the site that hosts the content,

\n\t

A maintainer may reach out to someone submitting content to request clarification or further information.

\n\t

\n\t\tRejection\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tProject maintainers may elect to not accept your submission if they feel it is not in line with the site's goals. This will be handled on a case-by-case basis.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tUnacceptable content\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tThe following content is not allowed on the website:\n\t

\n\t
    \n\t\t
  • Press releases,
    • \n\t\t
  • Content hosted on sites that violate our Code of Conduct,
    • \n\t\t
  • Content hosted on Medium,
    • \n\t\t
  • Content that uses a permanent accessibility overlay plugin, and
    • \n\t\t
  • URLs with UTM codes or other tracking mechanisms.
    • \n\t
\n\t

\n\t\tPromotions, partnership deals, and SEO scams\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tWe are not interested in quid pro quo schemes to boost your site's SEO ranking. We are also not interested in backlink, partnership, and affiliate linking programs.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tPlagiarism\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tThe A11Y Project does not condone plagiarism. We check submitted content for stolen phrasing and assets when submitted. People found plagiarizing content will be asked to stop contributing to the website.\n\t

\n\n\t
\n\n\t

\n\t\tGit and GitHub\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tThe A11Y Project is an Open Source project. It uses Git and GitHub to handle publishing new content and features, as well as coordinating maintenance.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tPeople working on more sophisticated aspects of the site (new features, bug fixes, etc.) are expected to have at least some familiarity with version control, GitHub's key functionality, and using feature branches to work locally.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tIf you are looking for a place to get started learning about Git and contributing to an Open Source project, Egghead.io offers a great introductory course.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tForking\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tTo submit updates and changes to The A11Y Project, you will first need to Fork the repository.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tForking will create a copy of the repository on your GitHub account. This will allow you to make changes on your copy and suggest incorporating them into The A11Y Project's repository in the form of a Pull Request.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tIf you do not plan on working on The A11Y Project for an extended period of time you can delete your Fork of the repository after your Pull Request has been merged without endangering our copy.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tBuild process\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tThis project uses Eleventy to convert project files into a website that a browser can read and display. You'll need to make sure you've run all the commands in our README to get Eleventy working.\n\t

\n\t

' StaticText '211' StaticText '212' StaticText '213' StaticText '214' StaticText '215' StaticText '216' StaticText '217' StaticText '218' StaticText '219' StaticText '220' StaticText '221' StaticText '222' StaticText '223' StaticText '224' StaticText '225' StaticText '226' StaticText '227' StaticText '228' StaticText '229' StaticText '230' StaticText '231' StaticText '232' StaticText '233' StaticText '234' StaticText '235' StaticText '236' StaticText '237' StaticText '238' StaticText '239' StaticText '240' StaticText '241' StaticText '242' StaticText '243' StaticText '244' StaticText '245' StaticText '246' StaticText '247' StaticText '248' StaticText '249' StaticText '250' StaticText '251' StaticText '252' StaticText '253' StaticText '254' StaticText '255' StaticText '256' StaticText '257' StaticText '258' StaticText '259' StaticText '260' StaticText '261' StaticText '262' StaticText '263' StaticText '264' StaticText '265' StaticText '266' StaticText '267' StaticText '268' StaticText '269' StaticText '270' StaticText '271' StaticText '272' StaticText '273' StaticText '274' StaticText '275' StaticText '276' StaticText '277' StaticText '278' StaticText '279' StaticText '280' StaticText 'Tatiana Mac has a great beginner\'s guide to Eleventy, if you are looking for a good introduction.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tAny changes you save will cause the local version of the site to recompile. The browser tab that has your local instance of the site will automatically refresh, allowing you to preview your edits.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tImportant branches\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tmain is the production branch. This is the live website.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tIf you have a feature request, we suggest first filing an Issue to discuss it (please read how to report an issue first). Once that feature has been approved you can start coding! Create a new feature branch from main, and name it something that references the feature you'll be working on. For example a feature to increase the site's type size could be: increase-font-size.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tA list of all active branches is available.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tEditing files\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tThis site uses specific kinds of files to help run the site efficiently. Eleventy will take these files and compile them into HTML, CSS, and other browser-friendly code.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tPlease make all edits in these files, and not the compiled code. If you edit the compiled code it will be overwritten the next time any file is saved and all your hard work will be lost!\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tSome of the main files this site uses are:\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tMarkdown\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tMarkdown is a lightweight markup language that makes writing easier. We use it mainly to organize our blog posts. It uses .md files and compiles into HTML.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tNunjucks\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tNunjucks is a templating language for HTML that uses JavaScript. We use it to create the templates used to build the site. It uses .njk files and compiles into HTML.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tSass\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tSyntactically Awesome Style Sheets (Sass) is an extension of the CSS language that adds many helpful features. Using it helps keep our site's visual presentation consistent. It uses .scss files and compiles into CSS.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tJSON\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tJavaScript Object Notation (JSON) is a human-readable way to store structured data. We use it to store information such as resources and commonly-repeated information. It uses .json files.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tSVG\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tScalable Vector Graphics (SVG) is a vector-based image format that makes crisp images with a small file size. It uses the .svg file format and can be either declared inline, or linked to as an image.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tYAML\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tYAML Ain't Markup Language (YAML) is a human-readable markup language that is good for writing structured data. This structured data is used specifically for posts and Eleventy page templates.\n\t

\n\n\t
\n\n\t

\n\t\tSubmitting new features' StaticText '281' StaticText '282' StaticText '283' StaticText '284' StaticText '285' StaticText '286' StaticText '287' StaticText '288' StaticText '289' StaticText '290' StaticText '291' StaticText '292' StaticText '293' StaticText '294' StaticText '295' StaticText '296' StaticText '297' StaticText '298' StaticText '299' StaticText '300' StaticText '301' StaticText '302' StaticText '303' StaticText '304' StaticText '305' StaticText '306' StaticText '307' StaticText '308' StaticText '309' StaticText '310' StaticText '311' StaticText '312' StaticText '313' StaticText '314' StaticText '315' StaticText '316' StaticText '317' StaticText '318' StaticText '319' StaticText '320' StaticText '321' StaticText '322' StaticText '323' StaticText '324' StaticText '325' StaticText '326' StaticText '327' StaticText '328' StaticText '329' StaticText '330' StaticText '331' StaticText '332' StaticText '333' StaticText '334' StaticText '335' StaticText '336' StaticText '337' StaticText '338' StaticText '339' StaticText '340' StaticText '341' StaticText '342' StaticText '343' StaticText '344' StaticText '345' StaticText '346' StaticText '347' StaticText '348' StaticText '349' StaticText '350' StaticText '

\n\t

\n\t\tNew features typically represent significant changes to the website. We ask that before you begin work on adding functionality or features that you bring up your proposed changes as a GitHub Issue first.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tThis helps the site maintainers anticipate and plan for incorporating large-scale changes, and how they\'ll affect the website. It will also allow us to see how your proposed changes align with our roadmap, as well as discuss accessibility implications.\n\t

\n\n\t
\n\n\t

\n\t\tFixing things\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tReporting Issues\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tHave you noticed something inaccurate or inaccessible? You can help make it better!\n\t

\n\t
    \n\t\t
  1. File an Issue.
    2. \n\t\t
  2. Preface your Issue title as an:\n\t\t
      \n\t\t\t
    • Inaccuracy for incorrect or inaccurate information (e.g. "Inaccuracy: Visually hidden CSS missing property declaration").
      • \n\t\t\t
    • Inaccessibility for an accessibility issue (e.g. "Inaccessibility: Low contrast link color").
      • \n\t\t\t
    • Bug for site issues (e.g. "Bug: Link at archive not working").
      • \n\t\t
    \n\t
    3. \n\t
\n\t

\n\t\tIssues are not to be used for free accessibility help. Project maintainers may close reported Issues at their discretion.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tSubmitting Pull Requests\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tCreating a descriptive Issue and assigning it to yourself before you send your Pull Request will help get it accepted. Doing so will provide a better understanding of what your request entails and why it was made. It also helps to link the Issue to the Pull Request and vice-versa (eg. "This Pull Request addresses Issue 213").\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tProject maintainers may reject Pull Requests at their discretion.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tWhen submitting your Pull Request, please include the text "closes" or "fixes" and then the issue number (e.g. "Fixes #101."). This will help us automatically close the issue upon merging the Pull Request.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tStale Issues and Pull Requests\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tProject maintainers will close Issues and Pull Requests if they become stale, leaving a note for the author as to why. This keeps our Issue tracker and code work clean and up-to-date, and helps project maintainers focus their attention where it is needed.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tStale Issues\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tAn Issue is considered to be in a "stale" state when any of the following conditions are met:\n\t

\n\t
    \n\t\t
  1. The last comment was made over three months ago.
    2. \n\t\t
  2. There has been no activity since.
    3. \n\t\t
  3. Someone has attempted to address the Issue, with no followup participation from the author.
    4. \n\t
\n\t

\n\t\tStale Pull Requests\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tA Pull Request (PR) is considered to be in a "stale" state when the following conditions are met:\n\t

\n\t
    \n\t\t
  1. The last comment was made over three months ago.
    2. \n\t\t
  2. There has been no activity since.
    3.   3. Someone has attempted to move the PR along with no followup from the author.
    4. \n\t
\n\t

\n\t\tLabels\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tLabels allow the project maintainers to quickly sort and filter site Issues and Pull Requests. They will be added and removed as needed.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tUpdating Posts\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tWhen updating posts, leave the original publish date and author as-is. Add the following to the front matter:\n\t

\n\t
updated_by: editor_name\nlast_updated: yyyy-mm-dd
\n\n\t
\n\n\t

\n\t\tContent we no longer support\n\t

\n\t

Following is content we’ve removed from the website and no longer support:

\n\t

\n\t\tEvents\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tThe A11Y Project used to list webinars, regional events, and meetups. We no longer support this feature. If you are interested in finding an accessibility-related group near you, please check our Meetups section in Resources.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tPatterns\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tThe A11Y Project used to list code patterns. We no longer support this feature. If you are interested in learning about accessible implementations of common User Interface elements, please consult the WAI-ARIA Authoring Practices.\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tWho to follow\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tThe A11Y Project used to list people to follow in the digital accessibility space. We no longer support this feature. Bruno Pulis maintains a list of notable people, companies and organizations, and meetups that contribute to digital accessibility and open standards.\n\t

\n\n\n\t
\n\n\t

\n\t\tLicense\n\t

\n\t

\n\t\tBy contributing your code and content, you agree to license your contribution under the terms of the APLv2.\n\t

\n\n
'
